Package ure.math

Class USimplexNoise

  • java.lang.Object
    • ure.math.USimplexNoise
  • public class USimplexNoise
extends java.lang.Object
    USimplexNoise implements a simplex noise generator, similar to Perlin noise. To use USimplexNoise, create an instance and use its multi() method to find the value of the noise at given x,y coordinates.

    • Method Detail

      • multi

        public float multi​(int x,
                   int y,
                   float[] scales)
        Calculate noise value for the given x,y coordinates, at a series of summed scales.
        Parameters:
        x - An x coordinate of indeterminate scale.
        y - A y coordinate of indeterminate scale.
        scales - A float array of one or several scales; higher scales are larger cycles of the noise pattern, lower scales are smaller. All scales are averaged together for the final result. Scales in the range of 5f-200f are most useful for coordinates of the scale of a typical game grid.
        Returns:
        The float noise value 0f-1f.
